p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from 'Engineer's Report' in the report of the meeting of the Tambo Shire Council held on 17 July 1891, in Bairnsdale advertiser and Tambo and Omeo chronicle, 30 July 1891, p. 3.

p.seg: [The flood that occurred on the 27th ult. in the Snowy River has continued the erosion begun by the flood of June, 1890. Steps should be taken to protect the banks from further injury by the cultivation of the willow or by any other means deemed advisable, as any other erosion might result in the destruction of considerable areas of alluvial land.â€”The secretary to write to Baron Von Mueller asking the best kinds of willow for protecting river banks.]

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: See M to Tambo Shire Council, August 1891 (in this edition as 91-08-00).
